intro: Coreopsis bicolor, commonly known as the painted daisy, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and often branched. Coreopsis bicolor is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes many other familiar flowering plants.
